event.title: was recorded as Safforde "sea ford" in 1128

data.event: It was recorded as Safforde "sea ford" in 1128, suggesting Old English name origins.

Another theory for the name of the area is that it was taken from Seaforth House, named after Francis Mackenzie, 1st Baron Seaforth, who built the mansion in 1813 for his daughter and her husband, Sir John Gladstone, father of William Ewart Gladstone, four times Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

event.title: the completion of Seaforth Barracks in 1882

data.event: A permanent military presence was established in the borough with the completion of Seaforth Barracks in 1882.
Seaforth Dock opened in 1972 and is the largest dock facility on the River Mersey.
Seaforth joined Crosby Municipal Borough in 1937, having previously been part of Waterloo with Seaforth urban district.

event.title: became part of the new Metropolitan Borough of Sefton on 1 April 1974

data.event: The whole of Crosby became part of the new Metropolitan Borough of Sefton on 1 April 1974.
